name: Four Points by Sheraton Houston Southwest

reviews.text: I spent two nights of the New Year Eve and First Day in New year , the room was in 7th floor , they were very spacious , very clean , breakfast meals were well-prepared.
reviews.title: Was perfect for New Year Eve in Houston

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was just 10min to discovery green park where I celebrated the new year , and close to some facilities as Kroger , chilis , chick filA , ...
reviews.title: Great location, nice rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recommend it , specially it was offer of 60$.
reviews.title: Okay, but better places are nearby

reviews.text: Stayed here 2 nights December 2011, to go to the museum district. The hotel's location is great for the museum district and Rice Marketplace, which has good eating places. The Galleria and downtown are also close by. Our room was very cold when we got there, but within 10 minutes of notifying the front desk, maintenance came and spent less than 2 minutes fixing the problem and getting the heat going. The room was clean and bed very comfortable. Personnel at the front desk were very friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: very good location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When visiting Houston we usually stay at the Marriott Courtyard that is just south of this place, on Westpark Drive. We recently decided to give this FourPoints a try. It is a solid 3 star place – not great, but not terrible. It is an older property that has been updated.
reviews.title: Satisfied customers

reviews.text: I've stayed at this hotel several times and I love the location. It's a short drive to just about everywhere and very convenient to Hobby Airport. There are great restaurants all around the hotel and even a nearby park across the parking lot for the kiddos. The staff is always friendly and the rooms are pretty spacious and comfortable. I will stay here again. The cost is always very reasonable.
reviews.title: Great location. Clean rooms. Friendly staff.

reviews.text: Little did I know that this hotel was the very same hotel made famous by a scathing power point presentation back when it was called Double Tree Club. It seems that the General Manager is still the same and he is still running a very poor property. It's a shame.
reviews.title: Diffferent Name, Same BAD Service

reviews.text: I stay aprox 50 nights a year at starwood properties. At the beginning of this year, I hopped from hotel-to-hotel every night so I could qualify for SPG Platinum sooner. I stayed here nine (9) times this year, and there is nothing wrong with this property, particularly because I paid no more than $80/night.
reviews.title: Very little is wrong

reviews.text: Check in each time has been quick and great. Everyone is friendly and they were starting to recognize me. Offered some water every time I checked in. One time my room was not ready when checking in early and I had to wait 10 minutes.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for.

reviews.text: The lobby is pretty modern, the hallways are very dated (but clean), but the rooms are brand new and modern, reflecting the new 4 points design. Hardwood floors when you come in. Pool is right on the freeway and is not very desirable. Gym is ok, one of each type of equipment, small, impossible to get machine in AM. Good places to run nearby, however.
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.text: Noisy broken down and needs help... yes the rate is low but in this particular hotel you get what you pay for. I have stayed here about 5 times and each time it gets worst and worst. I usually stay here because the location is great for me.
reviews.title: Noisy broken down and needs help

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -Ask for a room that faces the back... away from the freeway
reviews.title: Ignore the negative reviews at your peril

reviews.text: -Test the internet in your room before you unpack... as most rooms it does not work well
reviews.title: A Good Four Points, Good Access, Great Rate

reviews.text: -The people who work here are very nice but they are indifferent to the hotels challenges
reviews.title: Good location, improved rooms post-renovation

reviews.text: I am a Platinum SPG... and this could be the worst Four Points Sheraton I have ever stayed at.
reviews.title: One of the better Four Points properties.

reviews.text: This is a horrible hotel. The front desk clerk, Laine was very rude. I would not recommend. The only good thing about the hotel was the manager, Matt was very accomodating.
reviews.title: I Wouldn't Recommend

reviews.text: I strongly recommend NOT staying at this hotel. There are plenty of other hotels in the area that actually care about their customers.
reviews.title: Aweful customer service!

reviews.text: This is a hotel that has tried to be
reviews.title: Average but bad Air Conditioning

reviews.text: Trendy but failed to update the
reviews.title: Do not recommend for meetings

reviews.text: Necesities. The floors have no signs to find rooms and the A/C never got
reviews.title: Do you like staying at a hotel with NO A/C?

description: The Four Points by Sheraton Houston Southwest is centrally located between downtown and the Galleria, with easy access via U.S. 59 at Kirby. The rooms are well-appointed and feature upscale amenities.
